confession.seduction_context: After her husband was angry with her in their vines and called her witch. Ran off on her own, and devil approached her. She claimed she refused intercourse but he took her by force.

testimony.quarrel_subject: un fardeau de train (a burden of train) they had lent her some 5 years earlier

witnesses.name: Annon femme Mengin Regnault le jeune

timeline.subject: Zabel Tozel
timeline.details: Confronted with Ydatte Vaultrin veuve Demenge le Moyne, who maintained her accusation. Zabel denied it, saying 'et qu'elle est bien avengée' (and that she is well avenged).

timeline.subject: Zabel Tozel
timeline.details: Preliminary witness depositions taken from 8 witnesses

timeline.subject: Zabel Tozel
timeline.details: Said she was Zabel Tozel, aged 48 or 49, native of Rozieres, daughter of Demenge Tozel and Chenne Viary. Married to Olry Go of Housseville for 22 years. Knew she had been accused by Ydatte. Agreed to some instances when she had offered help, but denied any wrongdoing.

timeline.subject: Zabel Tozel
timeline.details: No real results; did not reproach witnesses, repeated much the same minor admissions.

timeline.subject: Zabel Tozel
timeline.details: Deposition from Jean Lonard jeune fils de Bar-le-Duc (in prison for theft) who was in fond de fosse with her. Heard mysterious scratchings on 3 or 4 consecutive nights while she was muttering. Confronted with Mengin Lamourou who claimed to have seen her at sabbat.

timeline.subject: Zabel Tozel
timeline.details: Rémy asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Zabel Tozel
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees to torture

timeline.subject: Zabel Tozel
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture. At first resisted charges, then asked to be taken down and confessed to witchcraft.

timeline.subject: Zabel Tozel
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death sentence

timeline.subject: Zabel Tozel
timeline.details: Definitive sentence by court at Rozieres

methods: question ordinaire et extraordinaire (no specific details given)

accomplices_named.name: Ydatte Vaultrin veuve Demenge le Moyne
accomplices_named.context: Named during confession under torture as accomplice seen at sabbat

accomplices_named.name: Catherine widow of Claudon Aubert
accomplices_named.context: Named during confession under torture as accomplice seen at sabbat. Encountered on way back from begging, taken to sabbat by Persil

accomplices_named.name: Baliatte la Cresseniere
accomplices_named.context: Her commere (godmother), already burned. Zabel claimed to have obtained herbs from her for 'estuve'

accomplices_named.name: unidentified woman
accomplices_named.context: At sabbat - described as 'une grande qui sembloit estre une bonne bourgeoise' (a tall one who seemed to be a good bourgeoise), wore mask and gloves

prior_accusations.accuser_name: Ydatte Vaultrin veuve Demenge le Moyne
prior_accusations.context: Confronted Zabel on December 18, 1603 and maintained her accusation
Had confessed to witchcraft and claimed to have seen Zabel at sabbat (January 6, 1604)

notable_quotes.speaker: Zabel Tozel
notable_quotes.english: and that she is well avenged
notable_quotes.context: Response when confronted by Ydatte Vaultrin (December 18, 1603)

notable_quotes.speaker: Jehenne femme Estienne Haxaire
notable_quotes.english: and that she would feel bad about it
notable_quotes.context: Response when Zabel asked if she was going to watch Baliatte la Cresseniere burn

notable_quotes.speaker: Zabel Tozel (via confession)
notable_quotes.french: il repouseroit ledit mal en hault
notable_quotes.english: he would push the illness back up
notable_quotes.context: Advice to Chenne femme Martin Cugnin about sexual relations with husband to cure bladder illness

relationships.evidence_text: Married to Olry Go of Housseville for 22 years
Annon femme Mengin Regnault le jeune
7 years earlier lived next to her
Ydatte Vaultrin veuve Demenge le Moyne

economic_context.details: Quarrel over 'un fardeau de train' (burden/load of train) that witnesses had lent to Zabel some 5 years earlier. Disputes over boundaries (clothes drying on hedges between properties).

harms_catalog.victim_name: cow owned by Jacquatte femme Francois Atiatte
harms_catalog.harm_description: Cow was ill for 15 or 16 weeks and had eventually to be put down
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: quarrel over 'un fardeau de train' they had lent her

harms_catalog.harm_description: Been in labour for 24 hours, and since then had been unable to control bladder. Various treatments by surgeons had done no good
Very ill for 10 days, hardly able to eat

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Zabel touching her stomach and offering to help exclusively

harms_catalog.harm_description: Miscarriage 8 years before, and another miscarriage at start of second illness

harms_catalog.victim_name: child of Barbeline femme Claude Micquel

harms_catalog.harm_description: Put on a shirt and immediately felt as if she was being eaten by ants, looked as if she had smallpox. Ill for 6 weeks, husband became angry and was on point of leaving house
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: clothes drying on hedges between properties

harms_catalog.victim_name: several animals owned by Jehenne femme Estienne Haxaire

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: her cat had been killed at his wedding

harms_catalog.harm_description: Killed using powder given by devil
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Zabel Tozel (confessed to killing her own cat to test powder)

material_culture.context: A burden/load of train that was lent to Zabel 5 years earlier, subject of quarrel
Medicinal steam bath or poultice made by Zabel for various people. Made with herbs from la Cresseniere and something from a paper by chimney
Jehenne put on a shirt that had dried on hedge between properties and became ill
Wife of Claude Micquel drank this soup; Zabel told her she should only take food made by Zabel
Given by devil to harm people; Zabel threw first batch away, used second batch to kill her cat
Given by devil to heal people
Obtained from Baliatte la Cresseniere for making 'estuve'
Zabel added something from a paper by chimney to the estuve
Jean Lonard was in prison on charge of stealing from a purse

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial, residence of accused and most witnesses
Origin of Zabel's husband Olry Go
Where wife of Jean Vosgien marchal moved because she thought Zabel killed her child
Where Zabel's husband called her witch; where devil seduced her; where devil met her 4 and 8 days later; where Annon saw Zabel lying with head between hands
Where Jehenne dried clothes; boundary dispute location
Where Jehenne saw Zabel behaving strangely
Origin of Jean Lonard jeune fils, witness from prison
Prison cell where Zabel and Jean Lonard were held; where mysterious scratchings were heard
Where Zabel confessed to going 7 or 8 times; where they danced, feasted, and made hail with 7 or 8 others

economic_hardship_indicators: Ydatte and Catherine widow of Claudon Aubert were begging when encountered

legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Held in 'fond de fosse' (bottom of pit/dungeon) with Jean Lonard who heard mysterious scratchings on 3 or 4 consecutive nights while she was muttering

hearsay_chains.content: Neighbour suggested that Zabel was responsible for wife's illness
Could only support wife's deposition by hearsay
Heard her reputed witch by wife of Jean Vosgien marchal, who thought she had killed her child

emotional_state_notes: At initial confrontation on Dec 18, said Ydatte was 'well avenged' - suggesting defiance or bitterness
During interrogation under torture, at first resisted charges, then asked to be taken down

third_parties.name: Ydatte Vaultrin veuve Demenge le Moyne
third_parties.context: Initially accused Zabel on December 18, 1603; later named by Zabel as sabbat accomplice

third_parties.name: Mengin Lamourou
third_parties.context: Had confessed to witchcraft and claimed to have seen Zabel at sabbat; she called him a wicked man

third_parties.name: Catherine Bernel
third_parties.relationship_to_witness: made soup for wife of Claude Micquel
third_parties.context: Made soup that Zabel told the sick woman not to eat

third_parties.name: wife of Jean Vosgien marchal
third_parties.context: Spread reputation of Zabel as witch; moved to Vilacourt because of this belief

third_parties.name: Jean Vosgien
third_parties.context: Husband of woman who accused Zabel of killing her child

third_parties.name: Baliatte la Cresseniere
third_parties.context: Already burned as witch; Zabel obtained herbs from her for making 'estuve'

third_parties.name: Jean Lonard jeune fils
third_parties.context: From Bar-le-Duc, in prison for stealing from a purse; held in fond de fosse with Zabel; testified about hearing mysterious scratchings and muttering

third_parties.name: Claudon Aubert
third_parties.context: Catherine was his widow; she was named as sabbat accomplice

third_parties.name: Olry Go
third_parties.context: From Housseville, married to Zabel for 22 years; called her witch in the vines which allegedly triggered her seduction by devil

extraction_metadata.notes: Comprehensive trial record with detailed witness testimony, confession under torture, and clear timeline. Notable for healing activities ('estuve' making) that became evidence of witchcraft. Case shows pattern of neighbors seeking Zabel's help for illnesses, then attributing negative outcomes to her. Confession obtained under torture names accomplices and describes classic sabbat elements. Marriage duration mentioned as 22 years. Zabel's response 'et qu'elle est bien avengée' suggests she felt vindicated or that her accuser had gotten what she deserved.
